keyword: how many calories in a chicken tenderloin
title: How Many Calories in a Chicken Tenderloin?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a chicken tenderloin, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Chicken Tenderloin?
assumptions: Skinless, boneless, grilled or baked; average size ~85 g cooked weight; no breading, marinade, or added fats.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, cut, cooking method, and brand; values are averages—check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One chicken tenderloin provides about 120 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Breaded and fried (adds ~100 kcal per tender)
Marinated with 1 tsp oil per tender

faqs.q: How many calories in a chicken tenderloin?
faqs.a: About 120 kcal for one average skinless, grilled tenderloin (~85 g).

faqs.q: What's the protein in a chicken tenderloin?

faqs.a: Yes, 0 g carbs per plain tenderloin.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in chicken tenderloin?
faqs.a: Grilling or baking keeps it low (~120 kcal); frying or breading can add 100+ kcal.

faqs.q: Is chicken tenderloin leaner than breast?
faqs.a: Similar—both are lean with ~2.5 g fat per 85 g serving.
